title: Why do Sejuani and Gragas have 100 and 110sec CD on ult at Rank 1?
body: While Amumu, Vi, Naut, Heca, Eve and Malphite whose ults can be compared to theirs have 140 or 150sec CD?

replies.body: {{champion:113}} and {{champion:79}} 's ults are less reliable, which is why they can be used more often. The ults you mentioned practically guarantee successful ganks due to being extremely effective, while having little room for error (several of those ults are point-and-click hard CC), and long initial cooldowns prevent those champions from snowballing the laning phase too hard in favor of their team.

Eve, I admit is a mess and really UP in my opinion. I'm not going to even try to argue her case at all.

Vi and Naut can be reasoned with that their ults are point and click for the most part, but honestly I'd chock that up to power budget. Vi has two casts on her E and a dueling passive that shreds armor and increases her attack speed on her W, so part of her needs to be underwhelming during the early game. Naut has a shit ton of cc in his entire kit, including his autos, so I wouldn't consider his ultimate to be too underwhelming with its cooldown considering you don't need it half the time unless the target flashes away or you want to be even more of a cc monster during a teamfight.

Hec, Amumu, and Malphite are a bit harder to narrow down. I want to say power budget, but I can only argue that for Amumu and possibly Hec. Amumu's ultimate locks you down and deals damage, just like Sejuani's ultimate, and deals the same exact amount of damage. You could argue that Sejuani's ultimate gets a lower cooldown because it's a skillshot and I believe it has a slightly smaller radius and it has a lesser stun time (1.25 -> 1.5 -> 1.75 seconds at each rank) than Amumu's (2 seconds at all ranks). I won't argue about Malphite, because I plainly just don't know much about the champion to fairly judge his power budget.

Not going to even bring up Gragas. His ult appears to be a skillshot similar to Annie's, but... eh. Don't really know much about him, but I'm just trying to help the discussion to the best of my ability.
Eve is not a mess at all

Most of her kit is fine, but her ult just doesn't make sense to me and it seems like they can't decide what to do with her W so she has sticking power to follow up with her ult.

Like I said, just my opinion.

You use the W to open up.  That's 3 seconds of speed boost on a 9 second cooldown.  Now you R, then you E, then you Q. Now all you have to do is spam 3 more Qs in 3 seconds and its up again.  Shes not for everyone.  40% CDR is key on her

Malphite is really good or not so good depending on who you are against
He is really good against AD and attack speed reliant champions  because he has an % armor increase in his W and his E is an insane AS slow... And attack speed slows are a lot stronger then AS buffs (because AS slows/reductions are calculated based on total AS.. while AS items and buffs work off base AS)

Though of course quite a bit of his power budget goes to this so he isn't the best against other champions which aren't AD and don't use attack speed

Source: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Sejuani

To answer the main question though is that it's due to the reliability of the ultimate's .

Amumu's is fairly easy to hit, Naut's is targeted, Vi's is targeted, Malphite's might as well be targeted because you honestly can't dodge it without a well timed blink, Eve is just in a not so good spot, and Heca's kit is just really good in the first place.

Sejuani and Gragas have lower cooldowns because Sej's is a rather slow moving projectile that can be dodged given you do it right and your team isn't a grouped target. Gragas' ult can backfire/completely fuck up.
They are less consistant.

"Why does Leona have a 90 second ult CD when every other support has a longer one?" - there are lots of comparisons you can make like this. At the end of the day not every ult with AOE CC is supposed to have the same cooldown, because every champion is different.
